questions.question: It is very difficult to give ……………………….. criticism.
Paying taxes is …………………………..
questions.description: If something is obligatory, it is compulsory.

questions.question: How can you be so ………………………. to her rude remarks?
questions.description: If you are oblivious to something, you are unmindful of it.

questions.question: Don’t be so ……………………….. in other people’s affairs.
The weather was good except for an ………………………… shower.
questions.description: Occasional means taking place from time to time.

questions.question: An egg with two yolks is an ………………………..
The peoples of the two countries must learn to understand …………………………
questions.description: One another applies to more than two people while each other applies to only two people.

questions.question: The army’s ……………………… march continued.
questions.description: Onwards can only be an adverb. Onward is always correct as an adjective or an adverb.

questions.question: Now would be an ………………………….. time to buy a new book.
The experiment was conducted under ………………………….. conditions.
questions.description: Optimum means ideal or perfect. Optimal means the same.

questions.question: Which of the following phrases mean in good faith?
questions.description: Bona fide means in good faith.

questions.question: The Ohio river forms the boundary …………………………. Kentucky and Indiana.
questions.description: To speak of two distinct objects we use between.
